definition: pavilion with a view/high/tall/high fronted, curtained carriage (old)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]

sentences.english: The argumentation on"holiday economic"had aroused a violent disturbance in China.
sentences.chinese: 关于“假日经济”的大讨论在中国引起了轩然大波。

sentences.english: A new book out in France has a literary world buzzing.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，一本新书在文学界引起了轩然大波。

sentences.english: The landslide occurred in the village caused a stir at home and abroad.
sentences.chinese: 青宁乡岩门村滑坡的发生在国内外引起了轩然大波。

sentences.english: His sudden death shocked not only those in the film  circles.
sentences.chinese: 谢导的死讯在影视圈内外都引起了轩然大波。

sentences.english: His sudden death shocked not only those in the film circles.
sentences.chinese: 谢导的死讯在影视圈内外都引起了轩然大波。

sentences.english: No one would expect a trivial thing could cause such a great disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 没料到芝麻大的事儿竟会引起这样一场轩然大波。

sentences.english: Just be the check caught, to provoke up a storm.
sentences.chinese: 正好被阿帕查撞见，惹起一场轩然大波。

sentences.english: Who could have thought a trivial matter would cause such a stir?
sentences.chinese: 没料到芝麻大的事儿竟会引起这样一场轩然大波。

sentences.english: I never thought this matter as gingeli will arouse such a great disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 没料到芝麻大的事儿竟会引起这样一场轩然大波。

definition: to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
